Posts.Content: raysnbucs wrote: The more I think about it, the less I want to deal with other surgeries after I have my BMx. I mean, does it really matter, a set of C cups is not hat defines who I am, it's my personality. Besides, I had already talked about just being an A if I did go though with it. But then that is about all I have in fat to work with anyways is an A. I know there are other women out there who desided to go flat, I want to hear from you on why you made that choice. For me, I suppose it's all about wanting to be as close as I can to how God made me.  "My precious, precious child. I love you, and I would never, never leave you during your times of trial and suffering. When you saw only one set of footprints, It was then that I carried you." Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2013 09:00PM raysnbucs wrote: I am from the Toldeo area, and will be mostly starting chemo this month for my BC. I see the Oncologist for the first time Wednesday, and hope she ill get the ball rolling ASAP. Which means I will not be getting to Cedar Point this year, or if I do it will be late in the season. I am kinda down that it also happens to be my 25 anniversary this June 11th, and not sure how much fun that will be. But my husband is being a champ about it. He could care less about the day, as long as I am ok, or as ok as I can be.
Posts.Title: Ohio Chemo Sisters Kelloggs Kelloggs

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2013 06:59AM raysnbucs wrote: kk12903 do you have dense breasts? I do and I was told since it is so hard to see if my lump would have come back as b9 they would have removed it anyways. Too make it easier to spot cancer. Personally, I didn't want anything in my breasts that made them feel different. So I had no problem saying yea let's take it out. Mine turned out to be IDC, that had been missed on a Mammo because of the proximity to the chest wall. Glad I had the MRI to get a better look.  Bean, I am in your shoes, I had to have a bone scan because of the findings on my MRI. I never want to have to do another again! I am waiting on those results, hopefully Monday. In the mean time, at first I was a nervous wreck, but now, I am accepting the possiblities that my treatment will include something to help it. Though I am still hoping the Spot in the bones is an old injury to my upper rib change.

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2013 05:33PM raysnbucs wrote: Just had my second dose last Friday. So far the only complaint I have is the pain that is involved with injecting it. Just glad it only lasts a few seconds. I take a 500mg tablet of Calcium with  200iu of D3 twice a day. So far it seems to be ok for me. Hoping it stays that way.

Posts.Content: raysnbucs wrote: I am 3 days post-op now. I had a bilateral mastectomy. One of my drains is clean, and has been for most of the day. Though there is blood in the line (Attached to the side wall). I have kept them all milked like we were showed today. But I am concerned. because of the lack of fluid coming out that one drain. The other three, are still producing. The right side being the worst, since it was the side that had the cancer, and they took some nods out of . "My precious, precious child. I love you, and I would never, never leave you during your times of trial and suffering. When you saw only one set of footprints, It was then that I carried you." Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2013 03:14PM raysnbucs wrote: To be safe, my doctor had me do an MRI. The MRI inturn made me have to go through another biopsy. This time on the original lump that sent me to the doctors to begin with. I will find out thursday if it is really benign like that thought, or if it is cancer. The doctor will not even do the surgery till she knows. If it is cancer, because it is 2 inches I will have to have Chemo & Radation before I can even have the operation. Now, I am really getting scared. This has been going on since very early Feb.
Posts.Title: 3 Spot Biopsy raysnbucs raysnbucs

Posts.Content: May 5, 2013 06:22PM raysnbucs wrote: OK this was told to me just this past friday, while waiting for dracula to take some blood, as part of a pre-op thing. It's not stupid shit, but it is something that you don't hear every day.  "If a man can't love you with out your breast, then he doesn't deserve to love you at all." Told to me by a total stranger, a male at that. His wife had stage iv melonoma. It came from a talk I was having with them and another woman about why we were sitting there. This totally made my day for a stranger tell me something like that.

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2013 03:48PM raysnbucs wrote: This morning I noticed my bandage over the left drains was really nasty looking and it scared me since it was the side I have been feeling some ripping like pain on. The doc took a look and said everything looked great. Because there was no major output of the left drains, he completely removed them. But the right side. The side I had the nods removed from, the drains were left. They are still getting 30+ccs a day. I also now can see my scars, since he took off all the bandages. Talk about startling.
Posts.Title: Drains raysnbucs Moderators

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2013 12:07AM raysnbucs wrote: I am not going to try to scare you here, but make sure you do get it checked. Hopefully, it will be b9. But I too had a lump, on the bottom of my breast where the breast ends. It is very close to my chest wall as well. I was sent  for a mammo, first I had in 7 years. All others always came back Cysts. Well the lump did not show up, but 3 areas of concern did. I was set up to have those sites biospied, 2 were b9 and one was DCIS. But they still did not know what the larger lump was. Since it was movable, they figured it was just a fibroadenoma. The BS I was sent to see, also thought this,  but the senior partner was not so sure. I was sent for an MRI and they preformed a second biospy on the lump itself, which turned out to be IDC. I will pray you don't have the same results I did, but the thing I am trying to say, is if the Mammo doesn't show it, don't stop there. you need to know for your peace of mind. Good Luck!
Posts.Title: seriously concerned ! trstamper placid44

Posts.Content: raysnbucs wrote: I don't want to scare anyone still waiting for their biopsy. However, I wanted to share my experience with it.  Yesturday I finally had my biopsy. They did two spots on my right and one on my left breast. The biospy itself when good, so the doctor tells me. They got the material they needed. However, when they did the after shot Mammograms, I had a black out spell. I felt it coming enough that I asked to sit a moment. The next thing I know I was in a bed laying down. They said said I was ash grey, and looking at them but not responding. I just remember saying not I didn't feel right when asked, before blacking out. It concerned me enough to ask about it. They told me it can be a normal reaction to the stress. As if that complication was not enough, one site on my right side, near where I felt the original lump would not stop bleeding. They had to finally use surgical glue to close it up. Now today, I am swollen and bruised, which they told me is to be expected since I had some after issues going on. If it still looks and feels as bad tomorrow i have to go back to make sure there is no hemotoma.  I should get my results on Feb. 11th. If the right side comes back bad, the doctor told me without a doubt, he will do a complete mastectomy on that side, since there was more than one issue on that side. The left, if bad, will just be a lumpectomy. But he did say it was very rare for someone my age to have three sperate areas with cancer, at least in both breasts. So I do still have hope.  "My precious, precious child. I love you, and I would never, never leave you during your times of trial and suffering. When you saw only one set of footprints, It was then that I carried you." Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2013 01:37PM raysnbucs wrote: Turns out the left is 'most likely b9' but the right, I will have to have a mastectomy scheduled, which will be done tomorrow as the scheduler was not in when my appointment was over with the doc. The positive thing is they believe it had not advanced passed the walls. He said a name but the minute I was told I had cancer or pre-cancer(?) my mind went blank.

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2013 03:34PM - edited Mar 30, 2013 03:35PM by raysnbucs I see the Oncologist for the first time on April 3rd. My BS is really prefering I do chemo, before she does surgery since my tumor is so big, and close to the chest wall. I don't think it is attached yet! They can get fingers under it. Once I have the appointment, I hope they will start quickly. Either way, I will be joining the April Chemo group.
Posts.Title: April 2013 Chemo Group BeHereNow 6cats

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2015 12:57AM raysnbucs wrote: For me it all started April of 2013, when I was Stave IV right out of the gate. Back then it was strictly spinal mets. Got one PET with NED and I was happy, the next the next vertebrae came back dirty. Had it treated, that was 2 months ago. Now the first spot on the back and the vertebrae directly above it is dirty. Not to meantion a 'few' small nodules in my rgt lung and left hip. At least that's what the PET scan showed. But both places have shown false positives before and i am hoping that's the case again.
Posts.Title: How long have you been Stage IV? goldie0827 dormouse

Posts.Content: raysnbucs wrote: Though I haven't had the chance to talk to my Oncologist, apparently my last PET scan came back dirty. L2 & 3 both shined up like a Christmas tree. Then so it didn't have to feel left out, so did my right lung. Though they are just nodules for now I guess. Still, my last PET scan was just in April, where L4 wanted some action. For these new spots to come up so soon has me scared. I had a rather non aggressive form of breast cancer in the beginning. With the doctor telling me it had most likely been in my body for at least 5 years before it was discovered. Has anyone else had had issues like this? "My precious, precious child. I love you, and I would never, never leave you during your times of trial and suffering. When you saw only one set of footprints, It was then that I carried you."
